Screen-Selfies

Screenshots I have taken myself from games I play

Remnant: From the Ashes

Remnant: From the Ashes is a Survival-Horror Action shooter developed by Gunfire Games. It is compared to the videogame series "Dark Souls"; because both games have strong enemies that can easily kill you unless you learn how to dodge their attacks and quickly dispatch them. I have beaten Remnant twice. It has taught me that no task is too difficult; and if at first you fail, try, try, try, reload, try, die again, scream, reload, try, try and try again; because at somepoint I will figure everything out and overcome the challenge. I am not scared of difficulties and I embrace challenge.






Destiny 2

Destiny 2 is a Looter-Shooter developed by Bungie. It's a first person shooter where every enemy is a new opportunity for cool loot, every environment is a new world to explore, and every player is a new friend waiting to be made. I have played Destiny 2 for over 1000 hours. It has taught me how to get along with many different people. It has also brought out my eye for beauty and helped me to learn how to make things look great. In the game, I am always chasing the next best gun; and in life I am always chasing the next opportunity to flex my creative muscles.






Forza Horizon 5

Forza Horizon 5 is a racing game developed by Turn 10 and Playground Games. It's all about buying expensive cars, tuning them to get the best out of them, painting them, and then taking them racing. I have played most of the Forza games on and off through the years, although mostly the Horizon series as they have huge open worlds for me to explore and appreciate. Forza has taught me to make good split second decisions and to never settle for something that is less than the best. I have also found that I am able to problem solve faster and more accurately.
